text:
How to remove your Siri voice requests from Apple servers
01 Nov 2019, 12:00 by Artyom Surovtsev
It's no secret that Apple can store and use our data to improve its products. This is clearly written in all user agreements and welcome windows with a description of the various iOS and macOS chips.
Cupertinians allow you to view the information on your Apple ID available on the company's servers, and after a recent software update, you can even delete some of the data.
üìç Thank you re: Store for the helpful information. üëå
At the moment, you can send a request to delete all data that the company collects during the use of the Siri voice assistant and Dictation.
The chip works in iOS 13.2 and macOS Catalina 10.15.1
How to delete Siri history using Mac



1. Go to System Settings - Siri.
2. Click Delete Siri and Dictation History.
3. We confirm the deletion of data from Apple servers.
How to delete Siri history using iPhone



1. Go to Settings - Siri and Search - History of Siri and Dictation.
2. Click Delete Siri and Dictation History.
3. Confirm the action.
